Help

This is a tool for exploring what bids the bidder considers for a given bidding sequence.

Click on the buttons in the Bid column to explore the bidding tree.

Rule is the name for rule used to make that bid (normally reflecting the conventional name). Blank rows represent bids the bidder would not understand.

Pri. is the internal priority number. Lower numbers are higher-priority bids. Blank entries indicate bids which either have the default priority or a dynamic priority based on context.

Resulting Knowledge is the hand-interpretation implied by that bid. Interpretations marked in red indicate that the bid represents an impossible hand.

Abbreviations:

2o32 of the top 3 honors
3o53 of the top 5 honors
3rS3rd round stopper
4rS4th round stopper
1rC1st round control
!1rCdenies 1st round control
2rC2nd round control
!2rCdenies 2nd round control
fsffourth suit forcing (convention)
return to bidder
